SENT.plain: An 11-year-old female felt discomfort in her head, and left hemispheric syndrome occurred shortly thereafter
At presentation, her National Institutes of Health stroke scale (NIHSS) score was 13, and a magnetic resonance imaging scan revealed acute brain infarction in the left thalamus
She was immediately treated with the intravenous administration of tissue plasminogen activator (IV t-PA) followed by edaravone, a free radical scavenger
Two hours after IV t-PA, her symptoms dramatically resolved and her NIHSS score decreased to 5
She was the youngest patient treated with IV t-PA in Japan, and would be the youngest treated in most developed countries

An optimal treatment for stroke in children has not been established, and this case highlights the urgent need to examine the safety and efficacy of IV t-PA and edaravone therapy for ischemic stroke in children
